item.title: Five bodies found in sunken superyacht, officials say
item.dc:creator: Stefano Pitrelli, Leo Sands, Adam Taylor
item.description: So far four bodies had been brought to shore from the wreckage of the Bayesian superyacht off the coast of Sicily, an official said.

item.title: Grief and anger in Israel as recovered hostages are laid to rest
item.dc:creator: Shira Rubin
item.description: Over the rumble of gunfire and explosions from Gaza, families in southern Israel eulogized their loved ones and bemoaned not being able to save them.

item.title: The student revolution that toppled a government
item.dc:creator: Peter Bresnan, Monica Campbell, Emma Talkoff, Sean Carter, Anant Gupta
item.description: After weeks of student-led protests in Bangladesh, Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina resigned and fled the country. Now the students and the military have formed an interim government. Can they make lasting political change?

item.title: Iran signals promised strike on Israel may not be imminent
item.dc:creator: Susannah George, Karen DeYoung, Leo Sands
item.description: Iran said a response to the killing of Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh “must be carefully calibrated” to avoid hurting prospects of a Gaza cease-fire.

item.title: U.S. Embassy denies Russian accusations of role in Ukraine incursion
item.dc:creator: Robyn Dixon
item.description: Russia’s Foreign Ministry condemned reporting by U.S. media into areas controlled by Ukrainian forces.

item.title: Police arrest man in Pakistan accused of fueling riots in Britain
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Hassan, Shaiq Hussain
item.description: Police in Pakistan accuse Farhan Asif of amplifying false information that helped spur far-right and anti-immigrant riots across Britain.

item.title: World’s oldest person, whose secret was avoiding ‘toxic people,’ dies at 117
item.dc:creator: Adela Suliman
item.description: María Branyas Morera, a U.S.-born Spaniard, died in her sleep. Her family said she recently spoke of nearing death and that she would miss daily mundanities like drinking coffee.

item.title: An elite rock climber lost his vision, then found a way to climb blind
item.dc:creator: Kevin Sieff, Chloe Sharrock, Yutao Chen
item.description: There are two ways to tell the story of Jesse Dufton. One is about a talented blind rock climber. The other — the more complete one — is a love story.

item.title: Switzerland will pay $58K for the best ideas to remove munitions from lakes
item.dc:creator: Maham Javaid
item.description: Munitions were buried in Alpine lakes, some more than 100 years ago. Now the country is seeking ways to get rid of them.

item.title: U.S. veteran who fled child porn charges now flies drones for Russia
item.dc:creator: Alex Horton
item.description: Wilmer Puello-Mota, a veteran who fled the United States in January, has appeared in Russian military propaganda videos touting his experience.

item.title: Hamas says Biden shows ‘blind bias’ toward Israel in cease-fire talks
item.dc:creator: John Hudson, Shira Rubin, Heba Farouk Mahfouz
item.description: The row between Hamas and Biden comes as Secretary of State Antony Blinken shuttled between Israel, Egypt and Qatar on a mission to pressure all sides.

item.title: Divers search sunken yacht as entrepreneur, five others, remain missing
item.dc:creator: Adela Suliman, Stefano Pitrelli, Kelsey Baker
item.description: Tech entrepreneur Mike Lynch and at least two Americans are among the missing after the British-flagged yacht Bayesian sank off the northern coast of Sicily.

item.title: Israeli military recovers bodies of 6 hostages in Gaza operation
item.dc:creator: Leo Sands, Kelsey Ables, Jennifer Hassan, Heidi Levine
item.description: The Israel Defense Forces said it recovered the bodies of Yagev Buchshtab, Alexander Dancyg, Avraham Munder, Yoram Metzger, Nadav Popplewell and Chaim Peri.

item.title: U.S. sanctions former Haitian president Martelly for role in drug trade
item.dc:creator: Widlore Mérancourt, Amanda Coletta
item.description: The U.S. Treasury Department said the singer turned politician sponsored several of the gangs that have waged a campaign of terror in Haiti.

item.title: Man accused of killing 42 women escapes police custody in Kenya
item.dc:creator: Rael Ombuor
item.description: Collins Jumaisi Khalusha, who was being held at a Nairobi police station, is said to have escaped by cutting through wire mesh in holding cells and scaling the perimeter walls.

item.title: How many hostages are still in Gaza since Hamas attack on Israel? What to know.
item.dc:creator: Victoria Bisset, Sammy Westfall, Helier Cheung
item.description: Israel estimates some 116 hostages held by Hamas have been released or freed; 71 are believed still to be alive in Gaza. Here’s what we know.

item.title: Who is Mike Lynch, the British tech entrepreneur in the superyacht sinking?
item.dc:creator: Rachel Pannett
item.description: The software millionaire was once considered the U.K.’s version of Bill Gates. The yacht trip came after his acquittal on U.S. fraud charges related to a 2011 tech deal.

item.title: How Chinese investors tried to take over an Australian mining company
item.dc:creator: Michael E. Miller
item.description: A struggle between an Australian mining company and Chinese investors has pulled back a curtain on the intensifying global conflict for rare-earth minerals.

item.title: British tech entrepreneur Mike Lynch missing after yacht sinks off Sicily
item.dc:creator: Stefano Pitrelli, Kelsey Baker
item.description: Lynch, his daughter, two other Britons and two Americans were missing after the 183-foot luxury yacht Bayesian sank in a “violent storm.” Fifteen people were rescued; one crew member was found dead.
